definition: to record sb's achievements in writing/to write a biography enhancing the subject's image
to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately
to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)
lit. to erect a stele and write a biography (idiom)/to monumentalize/to glorify/to sing the praises of

sentences.english: There are no monuments dedicated to me and my name will soon be forgotten.
sentences.chinese: 沒有人會爲我樹碑立傳，我的名字很快會被遺忘。

sentences.english: A painter's monument is his work.
sentences.chinese: 爲畫家樹碑立傳歸根結底還是他的作品。

sentences.english: These memories are, in fact, an attempt on his part to build up his own image.
sentences.chinese: 這本所謂回憶錄實際上是爲他自己樹碑立傳。

sentences.english: In the 25-dynasty history, there were 22 people recorded in Rui'an.
sentences.chinese: 二十五史正式立傳的瑞安人有22人。

sentences.english: Writing biographies of famous people has become a trend.
sentences.chinese: 爲名人立傳成了一個時代的潮流。

sentences.english: What monument would we build to online shopping or the 5 Cs?
sentences.chinese: 難道要爲網上購物或者五個C來樹碑立傳嗎？

sentences.english: Today, for example, we don't seem to need to set things down in stone.
sentences.chinese: 比如說，我們現在認爲，沒有必要用石頭來樹碑立傳。

sentences.english: As the first to write a biography of Tiele, Sui Shu is the basis of the research concerning Tiele.
sentences.chinese: 《隋書》最早爲鐵勒立傳，是研究鐵勒史的基本史料。
